meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside will roust the sleeping cat from its nap.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the alarm clock rousts me from my slumber.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon cooking in the kitchen roused the entire household from their beds.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech by the coach roused the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm roused the birds from their nests in the trees.

meanings.sent1: My mom had to roust me out of bed for school this morning.
meanings.sent2: The persistent alarm clock finally roused him out of bed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy roused the kids out of bed by licking their faces.
meanings.sent4: The urgent phone call roused her out of bed in a panic.
meanings.sent5: The smell of pancakes cooking downstairs roused him out of bed with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind roused the leaves from the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The landlord had to roust the noisy tenants from the apartment building.
meanings.sent3: The police officer had to roust the protesters from the street.
meanings.sent4: The sudden flood roused the animals from their burrows.
meanings.sent5: The loud music roused the neighbors from their homes.

meanings.definition: To rouse or provoke into action
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk roused the team to play their best.
meanings.sent2: The inspiring movie scene roused the audience to cheer.
meanings.sent3: The challenge of the race roused her competitive spirit.
meanings.sent4: The urgent call to action roused the community to come together.
meanings.sent5: The passionate speech roused the crowd to support the cause.
